activities.name: Power Strips
activities.tip: Did you know on average we waste 23% of our electricity on devices that are always on?  WHOA!  These devices are always on but used for only a few hours.  Put them on programmable power supplies.  For example, your TV, DVD, cable box are most likely used during the same hours and are located close together.

checklist.todo: Look for places that have a collection of always on devices plugged in.
START SAVING: Program the power strips, plug the devices into it, plug the power strip into the wall plug and start saving!

activities.name: Energy Audit
activities.tip: A home energy audit is one of the most important activities.  It will give you A LOT of info on saving energy as well as free LED lightbulbs if needed!  You set up an appointment for a home energy specialist to visit you home and determine how you can be more energy efficient

checklist.todo: Sign up for a Home Energy Assessment
Implement the energy savings activities you learned from the Energy Assessment

activities.name: Wool Balls
activities.tip: According to the EIA, dryers use 5% of our electricity.  When we added wool balls during drying our clothes, our drying time was cut in 1/2!

checklist.todo: Place in dryer during drying cycle.
Put back in bag after drying.
